description: Streamlined schema containing only fields used in RQ2, RQ3, and RQ4 analyses

Title.description: Paper title (from Scopus metadata, not LLM coded)

Authors.description: Author names (from Scopus metadata, not LLM coded)

Year.description: Publication year (from Scopus metadata, not LLM coded)

Journal.description: Journal name (from Scopus metadata, not LLM coded)

DOI.description: Digital Object Identifier (from Scopus metadata, not LLM coded)

Country.description: Primary country where research was conducted. Used in RQ2 for geographic distribution analysis. Extract from abstract, title, or author affiliations if mentioned.

Region_Global.description: Global biogeographic region where research was conducted. Used in RQ2 (geographic trends), RQ3 (theme by region), and RQ4 (international collaboration).

Research_Theme.description: Primary research theme of the paper. Used in RQ3 (thematic evolution) and RQ4 (applied vs taxonomic collaboration comparison).

Trichoptera_Relevance.description: Degree to which Trichoptera are the primary taxonomic focus of the paper. Used by all RQs to filter out non-Trichoptera-focused papers.

notes.metadata_fields: Title, Authors, Year, Journal, DOI come from Scopus API, not LLM coding
notes.removed_fields: The following fields were removed as they are not used in any analysis: Paper_ID, Citation_Count, Document_Type, Taxonomic_Focus, Family_Studied, Species_Studied, Ecosystem_Service, FFG, Habitat_Type, Method_Type, Data_Type, Scale, Author_Keywords, Indexed_Keywords, Notes, Relevance_to_Hypotheses
notes.author_data: Author_Count_Actual comes from fetch_authors.py (OpenAlex API), not LLM coding
